abstract: The human tumour suppressor gene PTEN/MMAC1/TEP1 encodes a lipid and protein phosphatase. Using RT-PCR, alternatively spliced forms of PTEN mRNA, encoding full-length PTEN and two forms of the protein truncated at the C-terminal end, were detected in normal human tissue. Cultured tumour and non-tumour cell lines show similar splicing patterns.
title: Alternative splicing of the human PTEN/MMAC1/TEP1 gene.
